name: Gradient

slides.title: Gradient: Data Trains, Vision Teaches
slides.subtitle: Our mission is to break down walls between technical experts, AI and physical automation to accelerate biology and medicine.

slides.title: Our labs and hospitals are rich in data but poor in comprehension
slides.subtitle: Data and system silos, and inefficient collaboration of humans with learning systems are to blame.

slides.title: We are Gradient, and our philosophy is: "data trains, vision teaches."
slides.subtitle: We are a human-centric company accelerating the next generation of collaborative tools.

slides.title: Here is the team that can make this happen.
slides.subtitle: Le is our scientific co-founder, professor at the Stanford teaching hospital. Sandy is our head of product, currently leading AI strategy at a leading biotech 2C company. Ben is our head of data, currently head of data sciences and automation at Orbital Therapeutics.

slides.title: This team has laid a solid foundation and we are now at an inflection point.
slides.subtitle: Our Lab-OS is ready for users, and Clin-OS is in design.

slides.title: Our first product, LabOS, equips AI with its "eyes and hands".
slides.subtitle: Kicking off co-evolution in the domain of biotech.

slides.title: Demo: AI with eyes and hands
What you see begins as human-AI collaboration.
slides.subtitle: ... and the inception of a spatial world model for deep science.

slides.title: We have already gotten a lot interest from pharma about how Lab-OS.
slides.subtitle: We are in active partnership discussions to capture ambient data in a pharmaceutical context.

slides.title: Our Clin-OS solution targets clinical pathology.
slides.subtitle: We are engaged setting up a pilot with Stanford teaching hospital.

slides.title: There is a huge market potential in creating operational efficiency and reducing errors in pharma and pathology.
In the near term, we are creating a subscription and partnership model to gain customers and to create a dataset.
Our long-term objective is to leverage our vision datasets of high-value tasks and world model which rewards human and robotic collaboration to execute and train a wide variety of high-value tasks.
We are fundraising for $30m and this will enable the key milestone of commercialization.
